text: Hi, I'm trying to start the node first time using "docker run --name CA_test_node --rm -it -p 5000:5000 -p 30303:30303 -e CORE_PEER_ID=vp0 -e CORE_VM_ENDPOINT=<http://172.17.0.1:4243> -e CORE_PEER_ADDRESSAUTODETECT=true hyperledger-ca-peer:version1 peer node start" but getting below error " 2016/06/22 12:01:13 Failed to listen: listen tcp: lookup vp0 on 10.0.2.3:53: no such host" ... can anyone pls advise how to fix this. Is this an issue with core.yaml?

Hi All. <@U1AJV5S2G> and I have been working together to come up with a concrete procedure for how to have the node sdk to build inside Vagrant. <@U1AJV5S2G> has been making some progress, but I am completely stuck with an error nobody apparently has gotten so far.

I am on a Windows 7 running Vagrant. I went through all of the previous steps outlined by <@U0ZR63HLK> with modifying the Makefile, updating the node version, updating the npm version, installing `sudo npm install node-pre-gyp -g`. I get farther in the install with that, but I am stuck on a very specific error from the very beginning.

`npm ERR! tar.unpack untar error /home/vagrant/.npm/grpc/0.13.2-pre1/package.tgz`

I am including my complete output below.

vagrant@hyperledger-devenv:v0.0.10-6006ec7:/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric$ make node-sdk
cp ./protos/*.proto ./sdk/node/lib/protos
cp ./membersrvc/protos/*.proto ./sdk/node/lib/protos
cd ./sdk/node && npm install
npm ERR! tar.unpack untar error /home/vagrant/.npm/grpc/0.13.2-pre1/package.tgz

make: *** [node-sdk] Error 185

From reading numerous github posts, it seems that the problem may be the fact that the file path name involved ends up being too long and exceeds some Windows limit. In this case the path is: `/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric/sdk/node/node_modules/.staging/grpc-73728bea/node_modules/node-pre-gyp/node_modules/request/node_modules/har-validator/node_modules/is-my-json-valid/node_modules/generate-object-property/node_modules`.

The proposed solution to this problem was to create a link to the node_modules directory from another location, for example: `sudo ln -s ~/tmp_node_modules/ sdk/node/node_modules/`.

However, that fails with:
`vagrant@hyperledger-devenv:v0.0.10-6006ec7:/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric$ sudo ln -s ~/tmp_node_modules/ sdk/node/node_modules/`
`ln: failed to create symbolic link ‘sdk/node/node_modules/tmp_node_modules’: Protocol error'`

Another post suggested adding the following to the Vagrantfile to set the configuration to allow symbolic links on Windows.
`vb.customize ["setextradata", :id, "VBoxInternal2/SharedFoldersEnableSymlinksCreate/vagrant", "1"]`
I tried modifying the Vagrantfile to add the line above, did vagrant destroy/vagrant up. But this still does not allow me to create the sympolic link and the `ln` command fails the same exact way.

I even tried going to the directory that is being mentioned in the error `/home/vagrant/.npm/grpc/0.13.2-pre1/package.tgz` and un-taring the package myself. The package seem fine and the  files extract fine, but the `make node-sdk` still fails.
I am out of ideas at this point :confused:, any suggestions would be greatly appreciate it. thanks, All!
Wow, that's really strange and quite esoteric especially because it is still not clear why some have it working and some not
<@U0Z81GL6S>: may you try to delete the node_module folder (from sdk/node) before restarting the procedure?
also, shall we have a google hangout session where to see in action these things?
